result.execSummary:
The defendant Derryl J. Frazier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the debt is not paid or payment arrangements have not been met, the Clerk of Courts office will refer the amount due to the WDOR for collection action.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derryl J. Frazier

records.addlTxt: 10:46 AM Defendant Derryl J. Frazier appears via Zoom videoconferencing pro se.  ADA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Hatch states Defendant is pleading to charge, requests $443 costs.  Defendant confirms agreement.  Court advises Defendant of right to be present, Defendant waives.  Court advises Defendant of right to counsel, Defendant waives.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is reviewed with Defendant.  Constitutional rights explained to Defendant.  Defendant pleads No Contest to charge.  Court finds sufficient facts.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court finds Defendant Guilty and adjudicates.  ADA Hatch states position, in compliance with victim rights.  Defendant makes statement.  Court sentences Defendant, orders $443 costs, 30 days to pay.  Court advises Defendant of right to appeal.  Adjourned at 11:04 AM
Plea hearing on November 10, 2020 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 3, 2020 at 02:00 pm.

No violent or abusive contact with CDW.
Return signed signature bond to Clerk of Courts Office by October 16, 2020.
Complete fingerprints and photographs at the Pierce County Jail by November 3, 2020.

ADDRESS INFO for Derryl J. Frazier
Current: 22105 Libby Rd., Bedford Heights, OH 44146 United States  (Effective: 10-02-2020)
Prior: 21981 Libby Rd. Apt 102, Bedford Heights, OH 44146 United States

03:03 PM Defendant Derryl J. Frazier in court pro se.  DA Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires about failure to appear, Defendant states he didn't know about the charges.  DA Froelich moves to quash the warrant.  Defendant has no objection, warrant quashed.  Defendant does not have a copy of the complaint, Court reads.  Constitutional rights explained to Defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Defendant enters NG plea.  State requests $10,000 signature bond with condition of no violent or abusive contact with CDW.  No objection, Court orders.  Standard bond conditions explained to Defendant.  Court questions Defendant's address, DOB and phone.  Non-military.  Court addresses return of signed signature bond and completion of fingerprints and photographs. 03:17 PM  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2020 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
